description:
Distinguish between different types of failures in the JSON
output of run_webkit_tests. This is so the dashboards
can match test_expectations.txt semantics. Eventually,
we can use this data to replace all the FAIL expectations
with TEXT/IMAGE/IMAGE+TEXT as appropriate.

Add a TODO to run_webkit_tests to get statistics right
now that we have IMAGE+TEXT expectations.

Treat simplified diff failures as TEXT failures for the JSON
output since noone seems to care about tracking it anymore.
We really should just stop spitting out simplified diffs at all.

messages.text:
One minor nit, otherwise looks good to me.

http://codereview.chromium.org/251096/diff/1001/1002
File webkit/tools/layout_tests/layout_package/json_results_generator.py (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/251096/diff/1001/1002#newcode396
Line 396: return "O"
Seems like "O" should never happen, and so maybe this should throw an exception rather than returning an unknown value? (I realize that's not part of this change ...)

http://codereview.chromium.org/251096/diff/1001/1002
File webkit/tools/layout_tests/layout_package/json_results_generator.py (right):

http://codereview.chromium.org/251096/diff/1001/1002#newcode396
Line 396: return "O"
On 2009/10/06 05:35:52, dpranke wrote:
> Seems like "O" should never happen, and so maybe this should throw an exception
> rather than returning an unknown value? (I realize that's not part of this
> change ...)

It can happen for failures that aren't worth the clutter of showing on the dashboard:
FailureMissingImageHash
FailureMissingImage
FailureMissingResult

subject: Distinguish between different types of failures in the JSON...
